commit_message:
Report all unreleased library changes

Look through the project-config repository for projects managed by the
library-release team and show what unreleased changes they have.

Change-Id: Ieca86fcb260cd9d6476b3777c300f16e84bebccc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/20/191220/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Convenience wrapper to show the unreleased changes in all # libraries, so we don't have to remember the incantation. if [[ $# -gt 1 ]]; then echo "Usage: $(basename $0) <branch>" exit 1 fi SERIES=${1:-master} TOOLSDIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )" source $TOOLSDIR/functions PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR=${PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR:-${TOOLSDIR}/../../openstack-infra/project-config} repos="$(cd $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR && grep 'pushSignedTag = group library-release' gerrit/acls/openstack/*.config | cut -f1 -d: | sed -e 's|gerrit/acls/||' -e 's/.config$//')" if [[ -z "$repos" ]]; then echo "No repositories were found by scanning $PROJECT_CONFIG_DIR" 1>&2 exit 1 fi $(dirname $0)/list_unreleased_changes.sh $SERIES $repos

the Heat stack create form and noticed environments can't be passed
without this patch.

commit_message:
add a tool to compare the constraints file with existing releases

Look at all of the managed libraries and compare their most recent tag
against the version in the constraints file.

Change-Id: I273141ce50663e909f7e145ba81c737b82637c3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/30/225230/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Check the constraints settings for OpenStack libraries against their # most current version. TOOLSDIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )" source $TOOLSDIR/functions if [[ -z "$VIRTUAL_ENV" ]]; then tox -e venv --notest source ./.tox/venv/bin/activate fi setup_temp_space update-constraints-$PROJECT title "Making a list of library repositories" repos="$(list-repos --code-only --tag type:library --tag release:managed | grep -v openstack-dev/pbr)" clone_repo openstack/requirements constraints_file=$MYTMPDIR/openstack/requirements/upper-constraints.txt blacklist_file=$MYTMPDIR/openstack/requirements/blacklist.txt for repo in $repos; do clone_repo $repo done title "Comparing constraints" for repo in $repos; do echo -n "$repo: " cd $MYTMPDIR/$repo # NOTE(dhellmann): Convert _ to - in the way safe_name() does to # find the matching constraint entry. name=$(python setup.py --name | sed 's/_/-/g') if [[ -z "$name" ]]; then echo "could not get name in $repo, skipping" continue fi if grep -q "$name" "$blacklist_file"; then echo "blacklisted, skipping" continue fi version=$(git describe --abbrev=0) expected="${name}===${version}" existing=$(grep $name $constraints_file) echo -n "$existing " if [[ "$expected" != "$existing" ]]; then echo "UPDATE $expected" else echo "OK" fi done

commit_message:
Specify api_version for functional tests

Most of functional tests are written for V2.0/V2.1 API version, but
launched on "latest" compute api version('--os-compute-api-version'
flag is not ovveriden + default value of it is "latest").

This patch adds "COMPUTE_API_VERSION" parameter for base TestCase,
which sets --os-compute-api-version flag while running "nova" shell.

Change-Id: I5d711438addaba5282a15fd2b9dde1800f7d7b91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/93/224593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: COMPUTE_API_VERSION = "2.1" COMPUTE_API_VERSION = "2.1"

commit_message:
Resolve issue with operating heat stack outputs

Sometimes, status of heat stack is not changed in DB
right after executing updating of heat stack. Because of
that sahara thinks that heat stack was successfully updated,
but it's wrong, because heat stack updating still in progress.

Because of that it's proposed to use field updated_time
for verification of successful update of heat stack.
We will store that field in variable, and will wait until that
will be changed.

Closes-bug: 1472536
Change-Id: Ifeee9a81ff1b37ff061de0ded371ae6f6bda4c95

commit_message:
Pep8 didn't check api/openstack/common.py

flake8 rule in tox.ini has following
exclude rule is exclude = .venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*openstack/common*
which excludes api/openstack/common.py

Change-Id: I39b82cf90048970e7bfc6be77de2e1543130f81b
Closes-Bug: 1498634
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/226516/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exclude = .venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*openstack/common/*,*lib/python*,*egg,build,tools/xenserver*

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

Change-Id: I4fd721d6f27bc0125144d960ee5028ce842a60f8

commit_message:
Glance `image set` Resolve Fracturing

Currently `image set` uses the new api, where other parts of osc the old
api is used. This deprecates the v2 api in favour of the v1 to maintain
the same commands across osc. However the functionality now remains
there as people could now be using this functionality.

This also adds the --unprotected argument, as in the previous version if
--protected was not supplied it would just make the argument
--unprotected without the users explicit consent.

The patch also fixes the documentation for image set as it was outdated.

Change-Id: I990d20332c80165102badef7ac94ddbeb7824950
Closes-Bug: 1498092
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/32/226232/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: protected_group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() protected_group.add_argument( protected_group.add_argument( "--unprotected", action="store_true", help="Allow image to be deleted (default)" ) public_group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() public_group.add_argument( "--public", action="store_true", help="Image is accessible to the public", ) public_group.add_argument( "--private", action="store_true", help="Image is inaccessible to the public (default)", ) public_group.add_argument( help=argparse.SUPPRESS # Handle exclusive booleans with care # Avoid including attributes in kwargs if an option is not # present on the command line. These exclusive booleans are not # a single value for the pair of options because the default must be # to do nothing when no options are present as opposed to always # setting a default. if parsed_args.unprotected: if parsed_args.public: kwargs['visibility'] = 'public' if parsed_args.private: kwargs['visibility'] = 'private'
deleted_lines: parser.add_argument( dest="protected", parser.add_argument( help="Scope of image accessibility. Valid values: %s" % visibility_choices else:

subject: scenario001: set API workers number to 4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 18:05:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/021084f41b837c72cdd3ec6f5baf397c3b7411ff', 'message': "scenario001: set API workers number to 4

When installing OpenStack-All-in-One with Puppet in OpenStack Infra

avoid more memory issues.

commit_message:
scenario001: set API workers number to 4

When installing OpenStack-All-in-One with Puppet in OpenStack Infra
Gate, we noticed [1] the same issues than devstack-gate [2] previously
had.
Let's use the same workers number as devstack is currently using so we
avoid more memory issues.
Also, using tox with 4 workers instead of 8.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/74/224974/11/check/gate-puppet-openstack-integration-dsvm-trusty/8217abb/logs/dstat.txt.gz
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/045396.html

Change-Id: I2ca3d897212cdcf25d8f50c0aef5f377395d4bc6

commit_message:
Disable tempest

We no longer need the RDO kilo repository due to the new delorean-deps
repo.  However, this means we no longer have any tempest package
available as we were pulling it from kilo before (which was probably
also wrong too).

Disable tempest by default. If/when a package becomes available, we can
propose to re-enable it by default.

Change-Id: I18d9cd8213bc2dc1d210250e7d25ddfad318fdce

commit_message:
Allow tempest to deploy when no heat in environment

Currently, the deployment of tempest will fail if heat does not exist
in the environment.  This commit updates
os_tempest/tasks/tempest_resources.yml so that users are only added
to heat_stack_owner role if tempest_service_available_heat is set to
True.

Change-Id: Ib3f6a11de60be86c1b2581d3c8da615d66ebae5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/25/226325/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Ensure tempest users have heat_stack_owner role when: tempest_service_available_heat | bool
deleted_lines: - name: Ensure tempest users have heat_stack_owners role

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 12:04:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/49e7f7926940842c4c7d685326c6060665b46d16', 'message': 'glusterfs: fix gluster-nfs export for volume mapped layout

The nfs.export-dir option is not suitable for specifying
whole volume exports (ie. exports for root directory).

Instead, we have to have nfs.export-volumes = on (contrary
to all other scenarios), and control the export via
the nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject} options.

So we subclassed GlusterNFSHelper to GlusterNFSVolHelper,
a new helper class that operates with a similar logic to
its parent, just works with nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject}
instead of nfs.export-dir.

The driver code detects if {allow,deny}-acces is performed
with a whole volume backend and if the helper given in
configuration is GlusterNFSHelper, then for the handling of
this call it switches over to GlusterNFSVolHelper.

NOTE: What we *don't* do: we don't set nfs.export-volumes to "on",
it's expected to be done by the admin, beforehand. The reason
is that nfs.export-volumes is not a per-volume option, but a
per-cluster and we don't want to mess up the access control of
the cluster by chance in an over-permissive way. The per-cluster
scope of nfs.export-volumes also implies that using a GlusterFS
backed with gluster-nfs export mechasim and volume mapped layout
is an exclusive choice: the cluster can't host it along with other
export / layout schemes.

commit_message:
glusterfs: fix gluster-nfs export for volume mapped layout

The nfs.export-dir option is not suitable for specifying
whole volume exports (ie. exports for root directory).

Instead, we have to have nfs.export-volumes = on (contrary
to all other scenarios), and control the export via
the nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject} options.

So we subclassed GlusterNFSHelper to GlusterNFSVolHelper,
a new helper class that operates with a similar logic to
its parent, just works with nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject}
instead of nfs.export-dir.

The driver code detects if {allow,deny}-acces is performed
with a whole volume backend and if the helper given in
configuration is GlusterNFSHelper, then for the handling of
this call it switches over to GlusterNFSVolHelper.

NOTE: What we *don't* do: we don't set nfs.export-volumes to "on",
it's expected to be done by the admin, beforehand. The reason
is that nfs.export-volumes is not a per-volume option, but a
per-cluster and we don't want to mess up the access control of
the cluster by chance in an over-permissive way. The per-cluster
scope of nfs.export-volumes also implies that using a GlusterFS
backed with gluster-nfs export mechasim and volume mapped layout
is an exclusive choice: the cluster can't host it along with other
export / layout schemes.

Change-Id: Ie4e4d03608f7a380cae790d429f88a5482d88ac8
Closes-Bug: #1495910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/17/225117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NFS_RPC_AUTH_ALLOW = 'nfs.rpc-auth-allow' NFS_RPC_AUTH_REJECT = 'nfs.rpc-auth-reject' # TODO(csaba): This should be refactored into proper dispatch to helper if self.nfs_helper == GlusterNFSHelper and not gluster_manager.path: setting = [NFS_RPC_AUTH_REJECT, '*'] else: # gluster-nfs export of the whole volume must be prohibited # to not to defeat access control setting = [NFS_EXPORT_VOL, 'off'] args = ['volume', 'set', gluster_manager.volume] + setting helper_class = self.nfs_helper if (self.nfs_helper == GlusterNFSHelper and gluster_mgr and not gluster_mgr.path): helper_class = GlusterNFSVolHelper helper = helper_class(self._execute, self.configuration, gluster_manager=gluster_mgr)class GlusterNFSVolHelper(GlusterNFSHelper): """Manage shares with Gluster-NFS server, volume mapped variant.""" def __init__(self, execute, config_object, **kwargs): self.gluster_manager = kwargs.pop('gluster_manager') super(GlusterNFSHelper, self).__init__(execute, config_object, **kwargs) def _get_vol_exports(self): export_vol = self.gluster_manager.get_gluster_vol_option( NFS_RPC_AUTH_ALLOW) return export_vol.split(',') def _manage_access(self, access_type, access_to, cbk): """Manage share access with cbk. Adjust the exports of the Gluster-NFS server using cbk. :param access_type: type of access allowed in Manila :type access_type: string :param access_to: ip of the guest whose share access is managed :type access_to: string :param cbk: callback to adjust the exports of NFS server Following is the description of cbk(explist, host). :param explist: list of hosts that have access to the share :type explist: list :param host: ip address derived from the access object :type host: string :returns: bool (cbk leaves ddict intact) or None (cbk modifies ddict) """ if access_type != 'ip': raise exception.InvalidShareAccess('only ip access type allowed') export_vol_list = self._get_vol_exports() if cbk(export_vol_list, access_to): return if export_vol_list: argseq = (('volume', 'set', self.gluster_manager.volume, NFS_RPC_AUTH_ALLOW, ','.join(export_vol_list)), ('volume', 'reset', self.gluster_manager.volume, NFS_RPC_AUTH_REJECT)) else: argseq = (('volume', 'reset', self.gluster_manager.volume, NFS_RPC_AUTH_ALLOW), ('volume', 'set', self.gluster_manager.volume, NFS_RPC_AUTH_REJECT, '*')) try: for args in argseq: self.gluster_manager.gluster_call(*args) except exception.ProcessExecutionError as exc: LOG.error(_LE("Error in gluster volume set: %s"), exc.stderr) raise def allow_access(self, base, share, access): """Allow access to a share.""" def cbk(explist, host): if host in explist: return True explist.append(host) self._manage_access(access['access_type'], access['access_to'], cbk) def deny_access(self, base, share, access): """Deny access to a share.""" def cbk(explist, host): if host not in explist: return True explist.remove(host) self._manage_access(access['access_type'], access['access_to'], cbk)
deleted_lines: # exporting the whole volume must be prohibited # to not to defeat access control args = ('volume', 'set', gluster_manager.volume, NFS_EXPORT_VOL, 'off') helper = self.nfs_helper(self._execute, self.configuration, gluster_manager=gluster_mgr) if not path: path = "/" if not path: path = "/"

commit_message:
MOS6.1 VBox use Intel instead of AMD; starting VMs without GUI

VBox scripts now use Intel e1000 Desktop as
a virtual network adapter instead of
AMD PCNet 32 Fast III used previously.
MOS6.1 -- Intel. MOS 5.x-6.0 --AMD.

Also, add info on starting VMs without GUI
with the headless=1 option in config.sh

Change-Id: I5e446f55fb84e08aede6f360df3558c48bb283ee
Closes-Bug:#1439561
Closes-Bug:#1390635
(cherry picked from commit 1d5fa543909ec7188b85599aa107fa46c2c9a15e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/40/207540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: in config.sh use ``headless=1``. The default setting is ``headless=0`` starts the VMs with GUI. Using ``headless=1`` will start the VMs without GUI. - As part of the improved networking configuration in Mirantis OpenStack 6.1, the VirtualBox scripts now use Intel e1000 Desktop as a virtual network adapter. This means that starting with Mirantis OpenStack 6.1, you can deploy on VirtualBox with Intel network cards only. Mirantis OpenStack 6.0 and older use AMD PCNet 32 Fast III as a virtual network adapter and cannot be deployed on VirtualBox with Intel network cards.

commit_message:
Add backlog for add extra field informing action states

Add backlog spec for add extra field informing action status as
a notification for further plans.

Change-Id: If002b0927190b67eb67609d9dc4c46532fd1ad9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/53/192053/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Add extra status field informing action/task states =================================================== Problem description =================== When using nova instance-action-list to show instance actions, the current response table returns an empty value in "message" field for succeed actions. On the other hand, when actions failed before or within nova-scheduler such as instance creation with no valid host, the response table for instance-action-list will also return an empty value in "message" field. This is confusing for users as they can not differ succeed actions from above mentioned failed actions. Use Cases ---------- Add extra status field informing action/task states will let users identify action/task states much more easier. Apps such as monitoring the percentage of succeed actions can be easily performed. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== Add extra status field informing action/task states Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- Add new response fields. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Zheng Zhenyu Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== References ========== History =======

subject: net: explicitly set mac on linux bridge
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 23:04:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9b9cb4e2cf3521016a9113dbfa94c69041a03525', 'message': "net: explicitly set mac on linux bridge

The default behavior on a linux bridge is to use the lowest mac of
all attached interface. This isn't a problem when the bridge is first
set up, because the bridged interface is the only interface attached.
But, when instance interfaces are attached, there is a chance a lower
mac could be assigned and the bridge will switch macs. This patch
always sets the mac on the bridge to the mac of the bridged interface.

Change-Id: Ibf5333516a4c5487a3ee7c662e07028789bdd286
Closes-bug: #1488686

commit_message:
net: explicitly set mac on linux bridge

The default behavior on a linux bridge is to use the lowest mac of
all attached interface. This isn't a problem when the bridge is first
set up, because the bridged interface is the only interface attached.
But, when instance interfaces are attached, there is a chance a lower
mac could be assigned and the bridge will switch macs. This patch
always sets the mac on the bridge to the mac of the bridged interface.

Change-Id: Ibf5333516a4c5487a3ee7c662e07028789bdd286
Closes-bug: #1488686

commit_message:
Add image name option to bm boot config

In order to be able configure bm deploy with various images,
option --deploy-kernel and --deploy-ramdisk were added to baremetal boot
config command.

Change-Id: I43a7de21f965bc344a9eea20b289182c875b6a83
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1249836

commit_message:
Stop false positive validation warning

Per rhbz#1260776, deployments that didn't specify flavors per role (not
using --compute-flavor flags) would have a false warning about "nodes
with no profile that will not be used." This commit prevents that
warning from showing up when no flavor arguments are provided.

Change-Id: Id6b9dcd881f1b45e64022e9ad4ed13a3dd648674

commit_message:
Adding socat as an rpm requirement

The fuel-misc package includes a script that needs socat but we are not
providing it as part of our centos repository. This change adds socat to
the requirements-rpm.txt

Change-Id: I951b137627880b20ece3c64e6a0c8b6ab473daab
Related-Bug: 1479033

commit_message:
Fix checking of available nodes

When deploying/scaling nodes, deployment nodes count was checked
against available nodes in ironic instead of all nodes (including
already used nodes).

Change-Id: Iddbffe7f4aad885abeeb97b1bd35e8828a581c64
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1260991

added_lines: # We get number of nodes usable for the stack by getting already # used (associated) nodes and number of nodes which can be used # (not in maintenance mode). # Assumption is that associated nodes are part of the stack (only # one overcloud is supported). associated = len(baremetal_client.node.list(associated=True)) ironic_nodes_count = associated + available if count > ironic_nodes_count: ironic_nodes_count, count))

commit_message:
Alter horizon.yaml to get screenshots copied.

Currently gate-horizon-dsvm-integration job marked UNSTABLE.

Previous patches tried to copy files using Jenkins,
which caused error. This patch copies the files to the workspace so 
Jenkins can copy them.

Change-Id: I69fb3865889d89b8f4e397b23e5546b2a6e1095f

commit_message:
Fix gate (caused by devstack using clouds.yaml)

devstack recently changed upload_image to use the clouds.yaml file
instead of tokens.  This caused redstack to break in the gate as the
file is written by devstack in the user's home directory.  Redstack
changes the home directory, so the file isn't found.

Added a call to create the file so it's available for the gate job.

Change-Id: Ia541930a5cb99068434fc41ade92efc8c383455f
Closes-Bug: #1498626
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/76/226576/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix for faafo install

The line installing the mysql library made it fail on
ubuntu 14.04. The pymysql library works just fine and
is already in requirements, so update the requirements
to remove the dodgy line

Change-Id: I83626ada5f2e26a6eac12676a6e3aa07d4e4b81f

commit_message:
Add support for pickling enginefacade context objects

In order to pickle a context object which refers
to an active _TransactionContextTLocal, we have to
use __reduce__ so that no database, engine, or session
state is pickled, and only a constructor remains.  Upon
unpickling, the constructor will install a new, empty
_TransactionContextTLocal on the new context, as is
appropriate since this is a totally different context object
than the original one.

Change-Id: Ia50cf10ff91a013ee24773c095a3df69ae06847b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/07/226407/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __reduce__(self): return _TransactionContextTLocal, ()

commit_message:
Allow empty lookup attributes if node_not_found_hook is provided

An operator might choose to completely replace our lookup with
a custom one, so we should not enforce even one attribute in this case.
If node is not found even using the hook, we will fail later.

Closes-Bug: #1497237
Change-Id: I61382fcff043c1f7388878ada459a157bd4f39fe

commit_message:
Mount config drive as loop device to supply data to cloud-init

Change-Id: I90e2c113fccb2b3a8330dd881887487786754fe9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/42/173142/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== Mount configdrive as loop device to supply data to cloud-init ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/loop-configdrive This blueprint implements an approach to expose configdrive to cloud-init through loop device Problem description =================== Current configdrive approach is to create a partition on disk and write the configdrive content into the partition in iso9660 format. The down sides we've experienced are: * Waste disk space to save small amount of data * Primary partition is needed For images like coreos, which already contains several primary partitions, config drive partition creation will fail due to the total number of primary partition is limited. * For partition based qcow2 images (versus volume based images), the whole physical disk will be used up although the original image is small, while leave no space for configdrive partition. * See bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1431527 "IPA: creation of configdrive partition fails if MBR & disk>2TB" To solve this problem, we can store the configdrive iso somewhere in the file system after imaging is done, then add an entry in "fstab" to mount the iso as loop device. When the system is up, the configdrive iso will be mounted automatically, and cloud-init is able to detect the configdrive by "config-2" label. Proposed change =============== Users shall still have the option to use partition based configdrive or loop device basedconfig drive, so a service level configuration option shall be added in Ironic service, while IPA shall accept this option. When calling "prepare_image" API, the actual value of this option will be passed to IPA. Once IPA detects loop device based configdrive is used, it shall execute following steps: * partx -a $device, discover the new partitions * vgchange -ay, discover new volumes * check all disk and partition block devices, if the size is greater than 0, try mounting the disk/parition * search for "fstab" file in the mounted disk/partition * if "fstab" file is found, make folder "cloud/configdrive" under the parent folder of "fstab" to save the configdrive content, and create folder "cloud/cfgdrive_mnt" as mount point * append an entry in "fstab" file, e.g. /etc/cloud/configdrive/config.disk /etc/cloud/cfgdrive_mnt iso9660 loop 0 0 Alternatives ------------ * Mount config drive to virtual drive With vendor specific tools, it's possible to mount configdrive to a virtual drive through network. But it'd be troublesome to deal with various tools from different vendors. Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- New configurable option in [agent] section will be needed: [agent] configdrive_type=loop Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jxiaobin <jxiaobin@ebaysf.com> Work Items ---------- * Change agent_client.py to pass "configdrive_type" to IPA * Implement mounting configdrive as loop device in IPA Dependencies ============ * The agent ramdisk must support the file systems in the targeting image Testing ======= A tempest test should be added that deploys a bare metal instance with a configdrive, and verifies that the configdrive is properly mounted to the instance as loop device. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== This feature is optional, so it is backward compatible. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation may need updating to indicate how to configure Ironic/IPA to mount iso as loop device to supply meta data. References ========== [0] http://cloudinit.readthedocs.org/en/latest/topics/datasources.html#config-drive

commit_message:
Eliminate DB reads in internal DNS integration

The queries to the DB executed by the internal DNS integration code in the DB
plugin are eliminated. The work done by the pluggable IPAM backends is re-used
to support internal DNS integration.

Change-Id: Ica661183274966abd2776fbf4139034d3b5d0d18
Closes-Bug: #1497450

suspend.

commit_message:
Add missing plugins for introspection rules

Conditions:
* in-net: checks if address is in a network

Actions:
* set-capability: sets a capability
* extend-attribute: append value to a list attibute

Helper method NodeInfo.replace_field is added to simplify writing
similar action plugins.

Implements: blueprint rules
Change-Id: I7e47b3500624df1f2cb15445d05e1c9bca6dc9ae

subject: Make test_revoke_cert_project_not_found_chdir_fails deterministic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-14 16:09:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_crypto.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f8f822afafbc58258bfe0653b21be86a5e648305', 'message': "Make test_revoke_cert_project_not_found_chdir_fails deterministic

Commit b64cebe2eb71a6c2275f6af76839a0b36cf56cbd removed the mock on
os.chdir to always fail with OSError in the test.

The revoke_cert method is using the ca_folder method to get the path and
that checks CONF.use_project_ca which is by default False, so the
project_id isn't even used in the path we're changing to before running
the command, it just uses the global static CONF.ca_path.  If that path
exists when this test runs, os.chdir won't raise OSError and the
assertion in the test will fail.

This change makes the test deterministic by (1) setting
use_project_ca=True and (2) using a random project_id uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1495547

Change-Id: I0dc6574b6644aa09028a07503a3d0b82e68e69d2
"}]
commit_message:
Make test_revoke_cert_project_not_found_chdir_fails deterministic

Commit b64cebe2eb71a6c2275f6af76839a0b36cf56cbd removed the mock on
os.chdir to always fail with OSError in the test.

The revoke_cert method is using the ca_folder method to get the path and
that checks CONF.use_project_ca which is by default False, so the
project_id isn't even used in the path we're changing to before running
the command, it just uses the global static CONF.ca_path.  If that path
exists when this test runs, os.chdir won't raise OSError and the
assertion in the test will fail.

This change makes the test deterministic by (1) setting
use_project_ca=True and (2) using a random project_id uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1495547

Change-Id: I0dc6574b6644aa09028a07503a3d0b82e68e69d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/223203/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid self.flags(use_project_ca=True) str(uuid.uuid4()), 'test_file')

commit_message:
Add some devref for AZs

Since the AZ knowledge is mostly tribal and can have some corner cases, we could
help the operators by giving more visibility on how it's made and what to prevent.

The related ticket mentioned below is one example of a common mistake that is
quite not easily fixable from the Nova standpoint since the design is mostly broken.

Change-Id: I092c8caa9e450a68a7a952940b0bb288b8fe6fb0
Related-Bug: #1444841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/223802/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Availability Zones (AZs) ------------------------ Availability Zones are the user visible logical abstraction for partitioning his cloud. Nevertheless, that abstraction doesn't come up in Nova with an actual model since the availability zone is actually a specific metadata information attached to an aggregate. Adding that specific metadata to an aggregate makes him visible from an end-user perspective and consequently allows to schedule upon a specific set of hosts (the ones belonging to the aggregate). That said, there are a few rules to know that diverge from an API perspective between aggregates and availability zones : - one host can be in multiple aggregates, it can only be in one availability zone - by default one host is part of a default availability zone even if it doesn't belong to an aggregate That last rule can be very error-prone. Since the user can see the list of availability zones, he has no way to know whether the default availability zone name (currently "nova") is provided because an host belongs to an aggregate whose AZ metadata key is set to "nova", or because there are at least one host belonging to no aggregate. Consequently, it is highly recommended for users to never ever ask for booting an instance by specifying an explicit AZ named "nova" and for operators to never set the AZ metadata for an aggregate to "nova". That leads indeed to some problems with the fact that the instance AZ information is explicitely attached to "nova" which could break further move operations when either the host is moved to another aggregate or when the user would like to migrate the instance.

commit_message:
Juno: Release python-ceilometerclient 1.0.15

This contains the g-r sync for stable/juno so that oslo.utils is
capped in python-ceilometerclient.

Note that we can't release this until global-requirements on
stable/kilo are adjusted so kilo doesn't pick up the 1.0.15 version.

Depends-On: I81409216c895fbf640bb0e9f3d772f09cd7052ca

Change-Id: I28d1b319cf5fe36c64e7b9f8a8ced67b072f660a
Closes-Bug: #1494516

commit_message:
RT: track evacuation migrations

The previous patch sets the stage for tracking resources when doing
evacuate, but we still have to make sure that
_update_usage_from_migration actually does the update of the resources.
To do that we have to make sure we are getting the right flavor in case
of 'evacuation' migration, and also that we are not completely skipping
over it.

Once that's done claims and resource tracking work as expected when
evacuating instances.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie74939e543155bc42705b28e1b44d943ef54ebdc
Related-bug: #1417667

commit_message:
Add OSSN-0053

Keystone token disclosure may result in malicious trust creation

Change-Id: Id9a693221da66a40b83d547e06b4b650e27203a5
Closes-Bug: 1455582
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/98/219898/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Keystone token disclosure may result in malicious trust creation --- ### Summary ### Keystone tokens are the foundation of authentication and authorization in OpenStack. When a service node is compromised, it is possible that an attacker would have access to all tokens passing through that node. With a valid token an attacker will be able to issue new tokens that may be used to create trusts between the originating user and a new user. #### Affected Services / Software ### Keystone, Grizzly, Havana, Icehouse, Juno, Kilo #### Discussion ### If a service node is compromised, an attacker now has access to every token that passes through that node. By default, a Keystone token can be exchanged for another token, and there is no restriction on scoping of the new token. With the trust API, these tokens can be used to delegate roles between the original user and a new user. Trusts allow a user to set up a long term delegation that permits another user to perform operations on their behalf. While tokens created through trusts are limited in what they can do, the limitations are only on things like changing passwords or creating new tokens. This would grant an attacker access to all the operations available to the originating user in their projects, and the roles that are delegated through the trust. There are other ways that a compromised token can be misused, but the issue of trust documented here appears most critical. This behavior is intrinsic to the bearer token model used within Keystone / OpenStack. With dynamic policy and a unified delegation model this will ultimately be fixed, but that is likely to be some time in the future. #### Recommended Actions ### Several steps can be taken to reduce exposure: 1. Monitor and audit trust creation events within your environment. Keystone emits notifications on trust creation and deletion that are accessible through system logs or, if configured, the CADF data/security/trust resource extension. 2. Offer roles that cannot create trusts / delegate permissions / assign new roles via Keystone to users. This limits the vector of attack to compromising Keystone directly or man-in-the-middle capture of a separate token that has the authorization to create trusts/delegate/assign roles. 3. Retain the default token lifespan of 1 hour. Many workloads require a single token for the whole workload, and take more than one hour, so installations have increased token lifespans back to the old value of 24 hours - increasing their exposure to this issue. #### Contacts / References ### This OSSN : https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0053 Original LaunchPad Bug : https://bugs.launchpad.net/ossn/+bug/1455582 OpenStack Security ML : openstack-security@lists.openstack.org OpenStack Security Group : https://launchpad.net/~openstack-ossg

commit_message:
Update OSSN-0033 to include lp 1436082

VMWare and HTTP stores do not verify HTTPS Connections as they use
httplib.HTTPSConnection. This should also be included in this OSSN.

Change-Id: I80548762acaf8e2b3348682c7f49062adcf4b84b
Relates-Bug: 1436082

added_lines: variety of internal services. The OpenStack Compute service offers a variety of configuration options which may be deployment specific. In this chapter we will call out general best practice around Compute security as well as specific known configurations that can lead to security issues. In general, the :file:`nova.conf` file and the :file:`/var/lib/nova` locations should be secured. Controls like centralized logging, the :file:`policy.json` file, and a mandatory access control framework should be implemented. Additionally, there are environmental considerations to keep in mind, depending on what functionality is desired for your cloud.

commit_message:
Fix Mongo report_root call to have correct args

report_root is being called in the case of a new instance being
created from backup when root is enabled on the originating instance.
A change [1] was made that added the context object to the report_root
argument list and the Mongo guest wasn't passing it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/124355/

Change-Id: Id61337ae85fb980752d606bddb2f1e574a345cba
Closes-bug: 1498568

commit_message:
Remove the unused scaleup command

This scaleup command was originally introduced to fill a gap missing in
python-tripleoclient (python-rdomanager-oscplugin at the time) but was never
removed when it gained the ability to scale up.

This implementation is limited because it assumes Tuskar and will fail in the
case of a more general Heat stack.

Change-Id: I980ca5ed50202b2d1b63a5c7505ccd7a5cc3d50a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/04/223504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def scaleup(self, role, num): LOG.debug('updating role %s count to %d', role, num) param_name = '{0}::count'.format(role) param = next(x for x in self.plan.parameters if x['name'] == param_name) if num < int(param['value']): raise ValueError("Role %s has already %s nodes, can't set lower " "value" % (role, param['value'])) self.plan = self.tuskarclient.plans.patch( self.plan.uuid, [{'name': param_name, 'value': str(num)}]) self._update_stack()

commit_message:
[Metering] Avoid using mutable in method defaults

Currently mutable additional_query is updated because
it is initialized in method defaults, it may cause invalid
timestamp queries to ceilometer api.
In this CR this behavior is fixed.

Change-Id: I94afcdb90cc6cee03c18d57abbfcbd1c2617dd20
Closes-bug: #1496539
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/79/224279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: period=None, additional_query=None): additional_query = additional_query or None

commit_message:
Don't send default environment file on pkg update or scale

With the improvements for bug 1224828 in Liberty, Heat now remembers the
stack's environment so there is no need to pass all environment files on
every update of overcloud.

Since user can now omit all the '-e' arguments on update operations
we also should not send the "basic" resource registry environment
file either because if only this file is passed on update operation
(without all the extra env files passed on create), it may cause that
resource_registry for some resources will be changed which causes
that existing resources are being replaced with new ones.

Change-Id: Ife06c2918da0af3839d8ad69ff9202b7ff40f2e5
Related-to: I2e2da03e6a36f3bc46bb608350e11f5431e0fcff
Closes-Bug: #1498607

upgrader.sh incorrectly handles cmd args - fixed

keyword arguments are passed to script as is.

commit_message:
Redirect all but cobbler and api from port 80

Redirect almost all from port 80 to port 8443 with SSL. Exclusions:
* API still have redirected to port 8000.
* Cobbler still uses port 80.

Change-Id: I872bb1c29df4b4775166944db7941296b352d93c
Closes-Bug: #1497397

commit_message:
[docs] Imporve Plugin Reference

Tables with plugins looks quite ugly so this patch removes tables
and use just rubrics and doctest_block types of nodes

Change-Id: Ifb5d53cfa1d86ab477671d3485d63fbf09f9246c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/12/226212/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "name": "scenario runner", "name": "SLA", "name": "context", "name": "scenario", "name": "engine", "name": "server provider", return { "name": p.get_name(), "description": "\n\n".join(description) } return map(process_plugin, plugin_base.get_all()) for p in _get_plugin_info(item): elements.append(nodes.rubric( text="%s [%s]" % (p["name"], item["name"]))) elements.append(nodes.doctest_block(text=p["description"]))
deleted_lines: "name": "Scenario Runners", "name": "SLAs", "name": "Contexts", "name": "Scenarios", "name": "Engines", "name": "ProviderFactory",def make_row(data): row = nodes.row() for item in data: node_type, text = item entry = nodes.entry() entry.append(node_type(text=text)) row.append(entry) return row def make_table(data): table = nodes.table() table_group = nodes.tgroup() for w in data["colwidth"]: table_group.append(nodes.colspec(colwidth=w)) table_head = nodes.thead() table_head.append(make_row(data["headers"])) table_group.append(table_head) table_body = nodes.tbody() for row in data["rows"]: table_body.append(make_row(row)) table_group.append(table_body) table.append(table_group) return table return [ [nodes.inline, p.get_name()], [nodes.doctest_block, "\n\n".join(description)] ] return { "headers": zip([nodes.inline] * 2, ["name", "description"]), "colwidth": [1, 1], "rows": map(process_plugin, plugin_base.get_all()) } elements.append(nodes.rubric(text=item["name"])) elements.append(make_table(_get_plugin_info(item)))

commit_message:
Added unit test cases for command-line shell

This patch adds missing unit test cases for command line shell.

This patch also replaces PORTS_DETAILED_RESOURCE to

PORT_DETAILED_RESOURCE.

Closes-Bug: #1444426

Change-Id: Ie6f4e6a3b715a3d6317218acc07c0aa684d67474
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/54/213654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_do_port_update_wrong_op(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = mock.MagicMock() args.port = 'port_uuid' args.op = 'foo' args.attributes = [['arg1=val1', 'arg2=val2']] self.assertRaises(exceptions.CommandError, p_shell.do_port_update, client_mock, args) self.assertFalse(client_mock.port.update.called) def test_do_port_list_sort_dir(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = self._get_client_mock_args(sort_dir='desc', detail=False) p_shell.do_port_list(client_mock, args) client_mock.port.list.assert_called_once_with(sort_dir='desc', detail=False) def test_do_port_list_detail_sort_dir(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = self._get_client_mock_args(sort_dir='asc', detail=True) p_shell.do_port_list(client_mock, args) client_mock.port.list.assert_called_once_with(sort_dir='asc', detail=True) def test_do_port_list_wrong_sort_dir(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = self._get_client_mock_args(sort_dir='abc', detail=False) self.assertRaises(exceptions.CommandError, p_shell.do_port_list, client_mock, args) self.assertFalse(client_mock.port.list.called) def test_do_port_create_valid_fields_values(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = mock.MagicMock() args.address = 'address' args.node_uuid = 'uuid' args.extra = ["key1=val1", "key2=val2"] p_shell.do_port_create(client_mock, args) client_mock.port.create.assert_called_once_with( address='address', node_uuid='uuid', extra={'key1': 'val1', 'key2': 'val2'}) def test_do_port_create_invalid_extr_fields_values(self): client_mock = mock.MagicMock() args = mock.MagicMock() args.address = 'address' args.node_uuid = 'uuid' args.extra = ["foo"] self.assertRaises(exceptions.CommandError, p_shell.do_port_create, client_mock, args)

commit_message:
Use only Neutron/VLAN for 'ha_one_controller_neutron_blocked_vlan'

Using other network segment types doesn't make sense for this test.

Change-Id: Ib3978337342b6fdad3908c96bc9da0205ff7cff3
Related-Bug:#1491845

commit_message:
Only get host data for floating ips on DVR routers

First, we are only interested in setting the host attribute when
the router is a DVR router.  Second, we don't need to query all of
the ports on the host, we just need to query the ports that are
referenced by the set of floating ips that we already have.

Closes-bug: #1496974
Change-Id: If611de14b2ab77d2eb9ce8c5b307ea6dd4403fe1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/23/224323/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Minor keymaster cleanup

Refactor'd some code.  Also, removed the logging of the 'key ids' in
'fetch_crypto_keys' as we no longer maintain the key ids, rather all we have at
this point is the real keys themselves, and probably not much point in logging
those.

Change-Id: I1c722df316ac84f4d9193ab8d34df8b8ea31f15c

commit_message:
Change fake_footers to replace response headers instead of append

This patch changes fake_footers to replace response headers so
that there will not be duplicate 'keys'.  The response headers are
a list of tuples, rather than a dict.  So simply appending can
result in duplicates.  This case should not occur, but has before.
An error log statement has been added if there would have been
a duplicate header key added.

Change-Id: I4dcd071756bd6298e7ce41642142ebb6a062d906
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/53/222953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: for item in footers.items(): self._response_headers.append(item) start_response(self._response_status, self._response_headers,

commit_message:
Fix install - update list of oslo libraries

devstack now validates that libraries installed using LIBS_FROM_GIT are
actually installed correctly.  This is causing install to fail with an
error:

[ERROR] /home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python:178 The following LIBS_FROM_GIT
were not installed correct: python-ceilometerclient python-saharaclient
cookiecutter oslo-cookiecutter oslosphinx oslotest oslo.version
pylockfile hacking pyCADF

The happens because the list of oslo libraries in localrc.rc is out of
date and needed updating.  This has been done.

The Sahara client library is also not installed by devstack anymore, and
was removed.

The default flag to load libraries and clients from git was switched to
false as well, to insulate from further changes.  These can be turned
on again using either options.rc or ~/.redstack.options.rc where needed.

Change-Id: I365f99356dd03562c30f674b843322ae5a2f0a6a
Closes-Bug: #1496104

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/96/221696/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _nova_rn_7.0: Nova ---- Resolved issues +++++++++++++++ * When one of memcahced servers is rebooted, all tokens it holds are lost. In that case, an `admin` token that `neutronclient` holds becomes invalid. The ``token_endpoint.Token`` plugin used by Nova, does not make an attempt to get a new token from Keystone in case of 401 errors. To fix this, identity.v2.Password is now used by neutronclient. The `auth_plugin` option is specified in `nova.conf`: .. code-block: ini :linenos: [neutron] auth_plugin=v2password See `LP1486503`_. .. Links .. _`LP1486503`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1486503

[RN 7.0] Serial console disabled by default

Informs users about the change and adds the description of
how to enable serial console for both target operating system
and bootstrap.

commit_message:
Add support for extended_properties for clusters

During cluster creation, we are now able to pass in custom
properties specific to a datastore as part of a data-bag
named 'extended_properties'. This allows us to get these
properties to the appropriate clustering strategy which can
then use them to implement datastore specific actions.

Change-Id: If24f5bf6181bf1502042ac51868a161a6a037bf2

added_lines: def create(cls, context, name, datastore, datastore_version, instances, extended_properties): datastore_version, instances, extended_properties)
deleted_lines: def create(cls, context, name, datastore, datastore_version, instances): datastore_version, instances)

Severity: Medium Confidence: High Location: ./examples/exec-py2.py:2 1 exec("do evil") 2 exec "do evil" - https://docs.python.org/2.0/ref/exec.html - __TODO__ : add info on exec and similar to sec best practice and link here

commit_message:
Revert change I2f8ae86e17d26ec4defa16e843faa8987d27fac9

The commit breaks creation of user rc file.
Now devstack doesn't create certificate for user
(because it's too early to do it) and doesn't react
to changes of EC2/S3 urls if they is recreated by devstack plugins.
So the commit totally broke ec2-api gating for example.

Change-Id: I069f46f95656655ae7ba8f3dd929f47eae594b68

Let's write out the auth config files so that if something # goes wrong subsequently, developers debugging have stackrc and clouds.yaml # files to use to poke at things # Create account rc files # ======================= # Creates source able script files for easier user switching. # This step also creates certificates for tenants and users, # which is helpful in image bundle steps. if is_service_enabled nova && is_service_enabled keystone; then USERRC_PARAMS="-PA --target-dir $TOP_DIR/accrc" if [ -f $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE ]; then USERRC_PARAMS="$USERRC_PARAMS --os-cacert $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE" fi if [[ "$HEAT_STANDALONE" = "True" ]]; then USERRC_PARAMS="$USERRC_PARAMS --heat-url http://$HEAT_API_HOST:$HEAT_API_PORT/v1" fi $TOP_DIR/tools/create_userrc.sh $USERRC_PARAMS fi # Save some values we generated for later use save_stackenv # Write a clouds.yaml file write_clouds_yaml

commit_message:
Fix the logic of node creation with specified cluster

Currently, the relationship between node and cluster will not be
established when node is created with a target cluster. Therefore,
some properties of both node and cluster are incorrect after node
creation, .e.g desired_capacity and nodes of cluster, index and
cluster_id of node. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Idde95519105b2a3b0ee68e7e591a1fee052cfc3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/12/225012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(dispatcher, 'start_action') def test_node_create_with_cluster_id(self, notify): c = self.eng.cluster_create(self.ctx, 'c-1', 0, self.profile['id']) cluster_id = c['id'] node = self.eng.node_create(self.ctx, 'n-1', self.profile['id'], cluster_id=cluster_id) self.assertIsNotNone(node) action_id = node['action'] action = db_api.action_get(self.ctx, action_id) self.assertIsNotNone(action) self._verify_action(action, 'NODE_CREATE', 'node_create_%s' % node['id'][:8], node['id'], cause=action_mod.CAUSE_RPC, inputs={'cluster_id': cluster_id}) notify.assert_called_with(action_id=action_id) self.assertEqual(2, notify.call_count) node = node_mod.Node('n1', self.profile['id'], c['id'], self.ctx) node_id = node.store(self.ctx) self.assertEqual(node_id, result[0]['id']) node = node_mod.Node('n1', self.profile['id'], cluster_id, self.ctx) node_id = node.store(self.ctx) self.assertEqual(2, notify.call_count)

commit_message:
Fix functional test of get_many_messages

This fixes the test for retrieving several messages by IDs, which was
previously not supported by falcon. Upgrading it fixes the behavior so
we need to change the test as well.

Change-Id: Icf355f9a6d667371a4f2b6077ca4954e1351e92d

commit_message:
Allow specifying cpu model/features in flavor extra-specs or image metadata

An end-user may want to write high-performance software that depends on certain
CPU features (SSE4.2, AVX, AVX2, LZCNT, FMA, BMI, etc) being available.
Currently we only allow specifying the CPU model as part of the compute node
configuration, and there is no easy way to select hosts based on the CPU model.

APIImpact
Implements blueprint cpu-model-per-flavor-or-image

Change-Id: Ie0a2701976fef0ed6e365f60868070b489ce25bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/82/168982/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================================== Allow specifying cpu model in flavor extra-specs or image metadata ================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cpu-model-per-flavor-or-image An end-user may want to write high-performance software that depends on certain CPU features (SSE/AVX, POPCNT, LZCNT, etc) being available. Currently we only allow specifying the CPU model as part of the compute node configuration, and there is no easy way to select hosts based on the CPU model. Problem description =================== Use Cases ---------- An end-user may have high-performance software that depends on specific CPU features. If the software is run on CPUs without those features it may not work at all or it may suffer serious performance degradation. The goal is to allow the CPU model to be specified as part of the flavor/image and allow the scheduler to select a host that can provide a vCPU of the specified model. Project Priority ----------------- Not a priority in Liberty. Proposed change =============== The change would allow allow specifying the desired CPU model as "hw:cpu_model=<model>" in the flavor extra specs, or "hw_cpu_model=<model>" in the image metadata, where model is specified the same way as in the nova config file (which is the same as what is understood by libvirt). A new scheduler filter will be written to filter out hosts with CPUs that are lower-grade than the specified model, and libvirt will be modified to set the instance CPU model to the specified model. All this would only take place if the config file for the compute node specifies virt_type="kvm|qemu" and cpu_mode="none". Alternatives ------------ It would be possible to have the admin user create a host aggregate for each desired CPU model. Each compute node would be configured to use the most recent CPU model that it supports, the admin user could add each compute node as a member in the aggregate for that CPU model and all earlier ones. Each host aggregate could set its CPU model via aggregate metadata of the form "hw:<CPU model>", and the desired CPU model could be specified via flavor extra specs of the form "aggregate_instance_extra_specs:hw:<CPU model>". In this implementation there would potentially be quite a few host aggregates and the end-user wouldn't get the exact model they requested but rather one at least that good. It would also be more work for the admin user to set everything up. Data model impact ----------------- No schema change is needed. REST API impact --------------- POST: v2/{tenant-id}/flavors/{flavor-id}/os-extra_specs The "extra_specs" request parameter can contain a new optional "hw:cpu_model=<model>" specification. POST: v2/{tenant-id}/images/{image-id}/metadata The "metadata" request parameter can contain a new optional "hw_cpu_model=<model>" specification In both cases, "model" is a string specified the same as the nova config file. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ If the new scheduler filter is enabled it will have a small impact on the time it takes to schedule an instance. If the feature is used to ensure end-user code gets to run as fast as possible it could have a large positive effect on the performance of end-user code. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: cbf123 Work Items ---------- * Modify virt/libvirt/driver.py to check the flavor/image to see if a CPU model was specified, and to use it if the nova config file didn't override it. * Add in a new VCpuModelFilter to the filter scheduler Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit test coverage will be provided. Documentation Impact ==================== The new scheduler filter will need to be described, as well as the new flavor extra specs and image metadata. References ========== None

commit_message:
Add user_id info: add 'user_id' to REST os-simple-tenant-usage output

Purpose is to give tenants a bit more auditing capability as to which user
created and terminated instances. Add 'user_id' to os-simple-tenant-usage
REST output, then we could get the user auditing from the REST output.

APIImpact

blueprint: add-userid-into-tenant-usage
Change-Id: I29cb6f4ba52eaf8df699bf5e38c40c17f78c74aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/37/198937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================ Add user_id info: add 'user_id' to REST os-simple-tenant-usage output ============================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/os-simple-tenant-usage.rst Purpose is to give tenants a bit more auditing capability as to which user created and terminated instances. Add 'user_id' to os-simple-tenant-usage REST output, then we could get the user auditing from the REST output. Problem description =================== For Project Nova,There is no user info in the tenant usage, we'd like the tenant usage including the user_id. Use Cases --------- When the tenant usage including the user_id, we will get the more detailed information about the tenant, and we cloud get the user auditing from the REST output. Project Priority ---------------- None Proposed change =============== Add API microversion v2.7, if the api request version greater than 2.7, then we add user_id to the tenant usage response. GET /v3/{tenant_id}/os-simple-tenant-usage/{tenant_id} Example response: { "tenant_usages": [ { "start": "2012-10-08T21:10:44.587336", "stop": "2012-10-08T22:10:44.587336", "tenant_id": "openstack", "user_id": "openstack", "total_hours": 1.0, "total_local_gb_usage": 1.0, "total_memory_mb_usage": 512.0, "total_vcpus_usage": 1.0 } ] } Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: liaonanhai Other contributors: Work Items ---------- Code that was submitted during the Liberty cycle can been seen at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151522/ Remaining work items are as follows: * Submit changes formally for review. * Participate in resulting discussions, mark up and re-review processes. * Repeat until done! Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Good unit/integration tests would need to be added before and during this work. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-14 09:18:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b049e414b1562f91de03f6398ff10ef6006e468d', 'message': 'compute: Make rebuild_instance RPC take node and migration args

If a migration record was created for an evacuation operation, we will
want to pass it over to the compute node. It will be required for
resource tracking, and we can avoid a round trip back to the conductor
by making it a part of the RPC call.

Also - if we called the scheduler, we also know the node of the chosen
host, and this infromation is needed for doing claims.

Change-Id: I0233f964d8f294f0ffd9edcb16b1aaf93486177f
Related-blueprint: migration-fix-resource-tracking

'}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2015-09-03 14:11:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e99d78e24f81cc41559e477adc1db9a88e0ef746', 'message': 'rebuild: RPC sends additional args and claims are done

If a migration record was created for an evacuation operation, we will
want to pass it over to the compute node. It will be required for
resource tracking, and we can avoid a round trip back to the conductor
by making it a part of the RPC call.

Also - if we called the scheduler, we also know the node of the chosen
host, and the limits set, and this infromation is needed for doing claims.

We also make sure that rebuild now uses claims and resource tracking. This
means that we will now be properly tracking resources for
rebuilt/evacuated instances and will potentially fail if a move of the
instance breaks policy set by the scheduler (an exception would be in
case we bypassed the scheduler).

With this change we effectively have resource claims when doing
rebuild/evacuate.

DocImpact

Related-bug: #1417667
Change-Id: I0233f964d8f294f0ffd9edcb16b1aaf93486177f

commit_message:
rebuild: RPC sends additional args and claims are done

If a migration record was created for an evacuation operation, we will
want to pass it over to the compute node. It will be required for
resource tracking, and we can avoid a round trip back to the conductor
by making it a part of the RPC call.

Also - if we called the scheduler, we also know the node of the chosen
host, and the limits set, and this information is needed for doing claims.

We also make sure that rebuild now uses claims and resource tracking.

There is a final piece of the puzzle missing, and that is the following
patch which actually makes resource tracker update it's resources based
on the evacuation records, and adds the relevant tests.

Related-bug: #1417667
Change-Id: I0233f964d8f294f0ffd9edcb16b1aaf93486177f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/200485/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * 4.3 - Add migration argument to rebuild_instance() preserve_ephemeral=False, migration=None, kwargs=None): extra = {'preserve_ephemeral': preserve_ephemeral, 'migration': migration} version = '4.3' if not self.client.can_send_version(version): version = '4.0' extra.pop('migration')

commit_message:
Link dashboards into generated documentation

Move the dashboard directory under the source tree so that
it is available on generated builds. In addition, recast
image pages as RST so that they will be rendered

Change-Id: I316128491e8dae70ac06e260f5bdd8f440d285aa
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
update event filter test to validate multiple trait args

in mongodb, we use to fail when more than 2 trait filters are given.
this test is to validate there is no regression. also, so it
can be backported.

Change-Id: I145d5393ddc193bcc1f346f5a0a2a09eaab16b0c
Closes-Bug: #1488716

commit_message:
Delete its corresponding history data when deleting an alarm

The history data of an alarm will still be stored in storage after the
alarm being deleted. that is easy to cause residue issue.

taken from: I5f6d7a1998104335079b7988e3d0b929b8854b28

Change-Id: I4ceb3de37640de6ba1534e70735410333810a488
Closes-Bug: #1476883

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.
This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: Ibb457fc16b64ead1acbf359531ecd79e624df8ab

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: nova-compute GDB backtrace

In trying to figure out what nova-compute is doing when it hangs in the
multinode job, we now trigger a guru meditation report to see what is
going on. But nova-compute isn't responding to that when it hangs, so
the next step is to get a gdb backtrace.

Hopefully we will see bug #1462305 on this patch soon so I don't need a
dozen rechecks

Duplicate of I89ba5f11de86c769e7db10cb1e1faa6e0a369aed to increase the
odds of hitting bug 1462305

Change-Id: Ib7fbf62981b4f48e949e4d1122f9fa17b7f31e4e
Related-Bug: #1462305
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/21/195221/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def gdb_bt(): _header("nova-compute gdb bt") print "running gdb bt command against nova-compute" _dump_cmd("sudo gdb -batch -p `pgrep nova-compute` -ex bt") gdb_bt()

commit_message:
Fix glance image upload in the gate

Glance in devstack was recently updated to rely on clouds.yaml instead
of using tokens (change I7092fb10cbe243e091789134263fab081af0c7f4).

This caused redstack to break in the gate as the file is written by
devstack in the 'stack' user's home directory.

Fixed this by linking the file from the 'stack' user's actual home
directory to the jenkins user's home directory.

Closes-Bug: #1498626
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ida0aa155b1e1ec7b8e9fa73006d3db9a88ffea02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/49/226549/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure the clouds.yaml file is available to redstack # This is needed since the gate doesn't run devstack through redstack link_clouds_yaml "${USERHOME}" "${HOME}" GLANCE_IMAGEID=`get_glance_id upload_image $IMAGE_URL`
deleted_lines: TOKEN=$(openstack token issue | grep ' id ' | get_field 2) GLANCE_IMAGEID=`get_glance_id upload_image $IMAGE_URL $TOKEN`

commit_message:
Fixes a Quobyte backend call issue with a wrong field name

No longer access backend data through statistics field.
Allows reading backend capacity info for Quobyte v1.2+.

subject: Fix proxy handling of EC client disconnect
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 22:32:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/f4b2253f56acbe00c45492b7f73ea2501d5c0a09', 'message': "Fix proxy hadling of EC client disconnect

The ECObjectController was un-conditionally sending down the frag
archive commit document after the client source stream terminated - even
if the client disconnected early.

We can detect early disconnect in two ways:

  1. Content-Length and not enough bytes_transfered
  2. Transfer-Encoding: chunked - w/o a 0\r\n\r\n

... if we detect either of these conditions the proxy should:

  1. *not* send down the commit document to object servers
  2. disconnect from backend servers
  3. log the client disconnect

Oddly the code on master was only messing up the the first part.
Backend connections were terminated (gracefully after the commit
document), and then the disconnect was being logged as 499.

So now we only send down the commit document on a successful complete
client HTTP request (either whole Content-Length, or clean
Transfer-Encoding: chunked 0\r\n\r\n).

To detect the early disconnect on Transfer-Encoding: chunked I've added
swift.common.exceptions.ChunkReadError to translate eventlet.wsgi's more
general IOError and ValueErrors into something more appropriate to catch
and handle closer to our generic ChunkReadTimeout handling.

Closes-Bug: #1496205

commit_message:
Fix proxy handling of EC client disconnect

The ECObjectController was unconditionally sending down the frag archive
commit document after the client source stream terminated - even if the
client disconnected early.

We can detect early disconnect in two ways:

  1. Content-Length and not enough bytes_transfered

     When eventlet.wsgi is reading from a Content-Length body the
     readable returns the empty string and our iterable raises
     StopIteration - but we can check content-length against
     bytes_transfered and know if the client disconnected.

  2. Transfer-Encoding: chunked - w/o a 0\r\n\r\n

     When eventlet.wsgi is reading from a Transfer-Encoding: chunked
     body the socket read returns the empty string, eventlet.wsgi's
     chunked parser raises ValueError (which we translate to
     ChunkReadError*) and we know we know the client disconnected.

... if we detect either of these conditions the proxy should:

  1. *not* send down the commit document to object servers
  2. disconnect from backend servers
  3. log the client disconnect

Oddly the code on master was only messing up the first part.  Backend
connections were terminated (gracefully after the commit document), and
then the disconnect was being logged as 499.

So now we only send down the commit document on a successful complete
client HTTP request (either whole Content-Length, or clean
Transfer-Encoding: chunked 0\r\n\r\n).

 * To detect the early disconnect on Transfer-Encoding: chunked a new
swift.common.exceptions.ChunkReadError is used to translate
eventlet.wsgi's more general IOError and ValueErrors into something
more appropriate to catch and handle closer to our generic
ChunkReadTimeout handling.

Co-Author: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1496205
Change-Id: I028a530aba82d50baa4ee1d05ddce18d4cce4e81

commit_message:
Make Quobyte shares actually read-only when requested

The string `access_level` won't ever be equal to `ro` in Quobyte Driver.
Do the right thing:
retrieve the `access_level` value from the `access` dict and
compare the result, as most likely intended but incorrectly implemented
and not tested. Also add the missing test.

Closes-Bug: 1498401

Change-Id: I735e5d0c91b5c8b258f4aa3461731ff293784995
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/75/191075/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: read_only=access['access_level'] == (manila.common.constants. ACCESS_LEVEL_RO),

commit_message:
Make end-points discoverable via Ironic API

This commit makes the following API end-points
discoverable via Ironic API
1. '/v1/nodes/<uuid>/states'
2. '/v1/drivers/<driver-name>/properties'

API Micro version is bumped to v1.14 with this change.

Closes-Bug:#1311288
Closes-Bug: #1475744
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibc0013b8c09c80d90042bf12b31a54820b00b43c

commit_message:
Enable node-update operation

This is a partial implementation for node-update. It is partial because
the nova-server path has not been tested. It is partial also because we
need to wait for sdk side patch gets merged in.

Change-Id: Iccc1a347f90ec11f2e6bd99964223c66b1fac5b7

commit_message:
install-guide: move note into file and include note from file

The "Default configuration files vary by distribution." note is
duplicated in a lot of files. This patch moves this note into a separate
file and includes this file in all files using this note.

Change-Id: Ie61e378a217539259180f2e56282b137dd8aa30a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/90/226390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. include:: shared/note_configuration_vary_by_distribution.rst
deleted_lines: .. note:: Default configuration files vary by distribution. You might need to add these sections and options rather than modifying existing sections and options. Also, an ellipsis (...) in the configuration snippets indicates potential default configuration options that you should retain.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 01:25:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/7998e5916261e5585d30d6af22cd05a8b9fc0e1e', 'message': '[install] Initial networking architecture changes

Implement initial networking architecture changes for Liberty
as follows:

1) Remove nova-network.
2) Develop architecture for provider networks with Linux
   Bridge agent.
3) Develop architecture for self-service networks with
   Linux Bridge agent.
4) Other restructuring as necessary to meet the primary
   goal.

For simplicity, both architectures require only two nodes,
each with two network interfaces, to deploy core OpenStack
services. Also, to address recurring issues about the lack
of support for connecting instances directly to the
public/external network, the self-service architecture
augments the provider networks architecture which allows
connection to both private and public networks.

Additional patches will address neutron configuration for
both architectures.

Change-Id: Ie3ab9a15ebfe82c0ce54f709c87a66d7cc46db3f
Implements: blueprint installguide-liberty

commit_message:
[install] Initial networking architecture changes

Implement initial networking architecture changes for Liberty
as follows:

1) Remove nova-network.
2) Develop architecture for provider networks with Linux
   bridge agent.
3) Develop architecture for self-service networks with
   Linux bridge agent.
4) Munge the neutron controller and network node configuration
   together.
5) Rejigger neutron to use the Linux bridge agent.
6) Restructure launch an instance content to account for
   two networking options.
7) Other restructuring as necessary to meet the primary
   goal.

For simplicity, both architectures require only two nodes,
each with two network interfaces, to deploy core OpenStack
services. Also, to address recurring issues about the lack
of support for connecting instances directly to the
public/external network, the self-service architecture
augments the provider networks architecture which allows
connection to both private and public networks.

Change-Id: Ie3ab9a15ebfe82c0ce54f709c87a66d7cc46db3f
Implements: blueprint installguide-liberty
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/60/221560/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _environment-ntp:You must install :term:`NTP` to properly synchronize services among nodes. We recommend that yuo configure the controller node to reference more accurate (lower stratum) servers and other nodes to reference the controller node.
deleted_lines: You must install :term:`Network Time Protocol (NTP)` to properly synchronize services among nodes. We recommend that you configure the controller node to reference more accurate (lower stratum) servers and other nodes to reference the controller node.

commit_message:
Consistency Editing LDAP section of Cloud Admin Guide

Improving consistency and brevity in the Cloud Admin Guide
keystone section, specifically the LDAP chapters, with consistent
procedures, lists, and descriptions of additional config
options.

Change-Id: If4815ee4ac3248c3efff936893f336ccca638fa6
Implements: blueprint user-guides-reorganised

For more information, see the `OpenStack Security Guide SSL introduction <http://docs.openstack.org/ security-guide/secure-communication/introduction-to-ssl-and-tls.html>`_.**To configure TLS encryption on LDAP traffic** .. hlist:: :columns: 1 * ``demand`` - The LDAP server always recieves certificate requests. The session terminates if no certificate is provided, or if the certificate provided cannot be verified against the existing certificate authorities file. * ``allow`` - The LDAP server always recieves certificate requests. The session will proceed as normal even if a certificate is not provided. If a certificate is provided but it cannot be verified against the existing certificate authorities file, the certificate will be ignored and the session will proceed as normal. * ``never`` - A certificate will never be requested.

commit_message:
Replace httplib import with six.moves.http_client

The httplib module was renamed to http.client on Python 3. Replace
the import with six.moves.http_client to be compatible with Python 2
and Python 3.

This change was generated by the "six_moves" command of the tool
sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: I6a00d3721b86155803d5dc567203f7a15b41c909
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/40/226540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import httplib status = httplib.OK status = httplib.MULTIPLE_CHOICES status=httplib.OK,

commit_message:
Replace xrange() with six.moves.range

xrange() was removed in Python 3. Replace it with six.moves.range().

Use six.moves.range() instead of six.moves.xrange() to have a code
looking like Python 3 on Python 2 too. IMHO it makes the code more
readable (and simpler).

Patch generated by the "xrange" operation of the tool sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: Id69f21448c92eb08494f761edf96cbc741b70a28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/37/226537/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves import range args = ['x%d' % i for i in range(max_index + 1)]
deleted_lines: args = ['x%d' % i for i in xrange(max_index + 1)]

commit_message:
Fix usage of dict methods on Python 3

Replace "dict.keys()+..." with "list(dict.keys())+...". Replace also
dict.items()[0] with list(dict.items())[0]. On Python 3, the keys()
and items() methods of a dictionary return an iterator, not a list.

Patch generated by the "dict_add" and "dict0" operations of the tool sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: I189c62b04a0590189a774154af298f9094d83ff2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/38/226538/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add LOGs to engine service entry points

This patch adds logging to engine service entry points. The intent is to
make sure every service has a trace record in log. We will need to
decide which ones from these logging calls should be replaced using event
calls later on.

Change-Id: Iab35852b3d5c258bc1e66c8fbed780afdcdfc625
