added_lines: * Now the volume attribute content in the Nimble driver is properly checked in the ``display_name`` and ``display_description`` arguments. If these arguments are not empty, they are translated to a volume backend description. The patch also modifies other places where returning an empty string makes sense rather than a ``None`` value, as well as a ``return`` value checking. See `LP1481681`_. .. _`LP1481681`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1481681

This patch adds Glance resolved bug's description to the

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/01/221701/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: configuration options: ``http_keepalive`` and ``client_socket_timeout``. See `LP1463522`_. * Previously, the errors in ``glance-reg`` were handled incorrectly, so ``glance-reg`` went down with an error saying that the initial error was not in unicode. The fix correctly encodes the exception error messages to the unicode strings. See `LP1474015`_. * Previously, if SSL was set for endpoints, :command:`nova image-list` command failed, because it tried to use HTTP instead of HTTPS while calling glance-client. Now this behavior is fixed, and Nova works when using HTTPS. See `LP1471992`_... _`LP1474015`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1474015 .. _`LP1471992`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1471992

commit_message:
[RN 6.0 MU6] Adds Swift resolved issue

This patch:
1) Adds Swift resolved bug description to the Maintenance
   updates section of Release Notes 6.0:
   https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1487450
2) Fixes indentation for a note in line 27 (so that it relates
   to its bug instead of the whole Swift section).

Change-Id: I63793e2da3214cb19fa99176230322ea123a5268
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/56/221756/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: Due to a conflict between configuration files, replace the old `swift-container-sync.conf` file in the `/etc/init` with the `swift-container-sync.conf.dpkg-dist` file which was created during the upgrade. * If a malicious user has a ``temp_url`` key authorized for a *PUT* access in a Swift account (tenant), he can retrieve different objects in the same Swift account (CVE-2015-5223). All Swift setups are affected. The fix prevents allowing the *PUT* method in temporary URLs to create pointers to other data.
deleted_lines: .. note:: Due to a conflict between configuration files, replace the old `swift-container-sync.conf` file in the `/etc/init` with the `swift-container-sync.conf.dpkg-dist` file which was created during the upgrade.

commit_message:
[RN 6.0 MU6] Adds Fuel resolved issue + edits

This patch:
1) Adds a Fuel resolved bug description to the Maintenance updates
   section of Release Notes 6.0.
2) Removes unnecessary numbering for a procedure containing 1 step,
   removes spare indentation in the command for consistency (lines
   17-20).
3) Small edits to avoid ambiguity (lines 13-17).

Change-Id: Id9c0db26adaf97950e4d54c388425b1553618707

commit_message:
Add magnum api client

First step in adding the magnum API to horizon is to create a connection
to the client.

Change-Id: I5f8cd3888ded01ed27f6afc854cf461f6c12ca4c
Implements: blueprint bay-model-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum-ui refs/changes/17/222617/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Cisco Systems. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from __future__ import absolute_import import logging from magnumclient.v1 import client as magnum_client from horizon import exceptions from openstack_dashboard.api import base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def magnumclient(request): magnum_url = "" try: magnum_url = base.url_for(request, 'container') except exceptions.ServiceCatalogException: LOG.debug('No Containers service is configured.') return None LOG.debug('magnumclient connection created using the token "%s" and url' '"%s"' % (request.user.token.id, magnum_url)) c = magnum_client.Client(username=request.user.username, project_id=request.user.tenant_id, input_auth_token=request.user.token.id, magnum_url=base.url_for(request, 'container')) return c

commit_message:
Multidomain false and project admin support

To test manually you need to

1. pull this patch
2. set your local_settings.py to
   a) OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS = {"identity": 3,}
   b) OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT = False
   c) OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL = "http://%s:5000/v3" \
      % OPENSTACK_HOST
   d) set your keystone policy file to
      ...
         'identity': 'keystone_policy.json',
      ...
   e) set your devstack keystone policy file to the same file
      i.e. /etc/keystone/conf/policy.json

3. goto login screen log in as Admin (cloud admin/project admin)
4. observe the login screen doesn't require a domain field
5. All new resources will be created in the default domain
6. No domain scoped token is required

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Nguyen <dan.nguyens.mail@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1472612
Change-Id: Ic1c4eb59e2a5704beb341e53c581d820a4e99f2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/51/199251/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if api_version >= 3 and not is_project_admin(request):def is_domain_admin(request): domain_token = request.session.get('domain_token') policy_check = policy.check( (("identity", "admin_and_matching_domain_id"),), request) and \ domain_token is_admin = request.user.is_superuser return policy_check and is_admin def is_project_admin(request, check_policy=None): # domain_token = request.session.get('domain_token') policy_ok = True if check_policy: policy_ok = policy.check( (("identity", "admin_and_matching_target_project_id"),), request) has_project_id = request.user.token.project.get('id') is_admin = request.user.is_superuser return policy_ok and has_project_id and is_admin def is_multi_domain_enabled(): return (VERSIONS.active >= 3 and getattr(settings, 'OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT', False))

commit_message:
Add epoch :1 on packaging

Due legacy 'fpm' package creation, we have to set the epoch of the
package as '1' for updates.

Fixes: https://midonet.atlassian.net/browse/MNA-812

commit_message:
Create is_service_default function

This change creates a parser function that can be used to check if a
value is set to the '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' string. The is_service_default
function will return true if the parameter passed in is '<SERVICE
DEFAULT>' otherwise it returns false.

Checks like:
  if ($our_param == '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') { ... }

Should be replaced with:
  if is_service_default($our_param) { ... }

This change will also be useful if we ever refactor the default value
string or have different values as this function could be updated to
support multiple values without having to adjust the calling code.

Change-Id: I07b8b9b54ed1e88891f74da9b930e4f39876a607
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/72/223672/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'is_service_default' do it 'refuses without at least one argument' do is_expected.to run.with_params().\ and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /Wrong number of arguments/) end it 'refuses too many arguments' do is_expected.to run.with_params('foo', 'bar').\ and_raise_error(Puppet::ParseError, /Wrong number of arguments/) end context 'is_service_default' do it 'with <SERVICE DEFAULT>' do is_expected.to run.with_params('<SERVICE DEFAULT>').and_return(true) end it 'with string != <SERVICE DEFAULT>' do is_expected.to run.with_params('a value').and_return(false) end it 'with array' do is_expected.to run.with_params([1,2,3]).and_return(false) end it 'with hash' do is_expected.to run.with_params({'foo' => 'bar'}).and_return(false) end it 'with integer' do is_expected.to run.with_params(1234).and_return(false) end it 'with boolean' do is_expected.to run.with_params(false).and_return(false) end end end

commit_message:
Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/13/226313/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: recordsets = central_api.find_recordsets(context, {'domain_id': domain_id}) records = [] for rrset in recordsets: records.extend([_format_record_v1(r, rrset) for r in rrset.records]) LOG.critical('Records: %r' % records)
deleted_lines: def _fetch_domain_recordsets(context, domain_id): criterion = {'domain_id': domain_id} central_api = central_rpcapi.CentralAPI.get_instance() recordsets = central_api.find_recordsets(context, criterion) return dict((r['id'], r) for r in recordsets) records = central_api.find_records(context, {'domain_id': domain_id}) recordsets = _fetch_domain_recordsets(context, domain_id) def _inner(record): recordset = recordsets[record['recordset_id']] return _format_record_v1(record, recordset) records = [_inner(r) for r in records]

subject: Correct a possible DNSService connection leak
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 10:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/bf5e2dda615914534fdd11b55f2c4f8b50aa1db9', 'message': 'Correct a possible DNSService connection leak

There was a potential codepath where, if after parsing
a packet, an exception was raused, we may leave TCP sockets
around without explicitly closing them

Change-Id: I6d619d05c7d0250cb5ae55212129e0d849c66c9d

commit_message:
Correct a possible DNSService connection leak

There was a potential codepath where, if after parsing
a packet, an exception was raused, we may leave TCP sockets
around without explicitly closing them

Change-Id: I6d619d05c7d0250cb5ae55212129e0d849c66c9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/31/226231/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # Close the TCP connection if we have one. if client: client.close()

commit_message:
Ensure API workers > 1 starts correctly

* Move DNSUtils bind methods into designate.utils
* Switch WSGIService to using the bind_tcp method
* Add support for TCP_KEEPIDLE to the bind_tcp method

Change-Id: If2d554fd757969f5b833ede6cb635bb4901906a7
Closes-Bug: 1498054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/24/226224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import socketfrom designate.i18n import _LI def bind_tcp(host, port, tcp_backlog, tcp_keepidle=None): # Bind to the TCP port LOG.info(_LI('Opening TCP Listening Socket on %(host)s:%(port)d') % {'host': host, 'port': port}) sock_tcp = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) sock_tcp.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1) sock_tcp.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_KEEPALIVE, 1) # NOTE: Linux supports socket.SO_REUSEPORT only in 3.9 and later releases. try: sock_tcp.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEPORT, 1) except Exception: pass # This option isn't available in the OS X version of eventlet if tcp_keepidle and hasattr(socket, 'TCP_KEEPIDLE'): sock_tcp.setsockopt(socket.IPPROTO_TCP, socket.TCP_KEEPIDLE, tcp_keepidle) sock_tcp.setblocking(True) sock_tcp.bind((host, port)) sock_tcp.listen(tcp_backlog) return sock_tcp def bind_udp(host, port): # Bind to the UDP port LOG.info(_LI('Opening UDP Listening Socket on %(host)s:%(port)d') % {'host': host, 'port': port}) sock_udp = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_DGRAM) sock_udp.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1) # NOTE: Linux supports socket.SO_REUSEPORT only in 3.9 and later releases. try: sock_udp.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEPORT, 1) except Exception: pass sock_udp.setblocking(True) sock_udp.bind((host, port)) return sock_udp

commit_message:
Unauthed tests for RecordSets (Security)

These tests will attempt CRUD operations against RecordSets without
auth tokens. All requests should return 401 (Unauthorized).

Change-Id: I2959f5438efa748042a1c2ef7fa03d17f5892ef2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/45/223745/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """ Copyright 2015 Rackspace Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. """ from tempest_lib import exceptions from functionaltests.common import datagen from functionaltests.common import utils from functionaltests.api.v2.base import DesignateV2Test from functionaltests.api.v2.clients.recordset_client import RecordsetClient from functionaltests.api.v2.clients.zone_client import ZoneClient @utils.parameterized_class class RecordsetTest(DesignateV2Test): def setUp(self): super(RecordsetTest, self).setUp() self.increase_quotas(user='admin') resp, self.zone = ZoneClient.as_user('default').post_zone( datagen.random_zone_data()) ZoneClient.as_user('default').wait_for_zone(self.zone.id) self.client = RecordsetClient.as_user('no_auth') def tearDown(self): super(RecordsetTest, self).tearDown() resp, self.zone = ZoneClient.as_user('default').delete_zone( self.zone.id) def test_create_a_recordset(self): post_model = datagen.random_a_recordset(self.zone.name) status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.post_recordset, self.zone.id, post_model) self.assertTrue(status) def test_get_fake_recordset(self): status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.get_recordset, self.zone.id, 'junk') self.assertTrue(status) def test_get_existing_recordset(self): post_model = datagen.random_a_recordset(self.zone.name) resp, resp_model = RecordsetClient.as_user('default') \ .post_recordset(self.zone.id, post_model) status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.get_recordset, self.zone.id, resp_model.id) self.assertTrue(status) def test_list_recordsets(self): status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.list_recordsets, self.zone.id) self.assertTrue(status) def test_update_fake_recordset(self): put_model = datagen.random_a_recordset(self.zone.name) status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.put_recordset, self.zone.id, 'junk', put_model) self.assertTrue(status) def test_update_existing_recordset(self): post_model = datagen.random_a_recordset(self.zone.name) resp, resp_model = RecordsetClient.as_user('default') \ .post_recordset(self.zone.id, post_model) status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.put_recordset, self.zone.id, resp_model.id, post_model) self.assertTrue(status) def test_delete_fake_recordset(self): status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.delete_recordset, self.zone.id, 'junk') self.assertTrue(status) def test_delete_existing_recordset(self): post_model = datagen.random_a_recordset(self.zone.name) resp, resp_model = RecordsetClient.as_user('default') \ .post_recordset(self.zone.id, post_model) status, exc = verify_unauthed_exception( self.client.delete_recordset, self.zone.id, resp_model.id) self.assertTrue(status) def verify_unauthed_exception(method, *args, **kwargs): """Helper method to verify that we get an Unauthorized exception :return (status, exception), where "status" is a boolean for whether the exception thrown is exceptions.Unauthorized, and "exception" is the exception object that was thrown. """ try: resp, model = method(*args, **kwargs) return (False, None) except exceptions.Unauthorized as e: return (True, e) except Exception as e: return (False, e)

commit_message:
gate: custom handling of cloudera images

Generating cloudera images requires lots of space, in terms of cached
resources (distribution base images, packages, etc) and generated
images. This causes the generation of all the cloudera images to
(almost?) always fail on the gate slaves, as running out of space.

As a workaround to this, manually invoke the generation of cloudera
images per-distro, cleaning the cache (which contains mostly stuff
specific to the last built distribution) and the generated images after
each run.

Change-Id: I4468f9e2926e101864e73f8aedf7b0612a3f7a96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/17/223017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: case "$PLUGIN" in "cloudera") # manually call each distro for cloudera, so we can cleanup # cache and generated images from the previous run # (saving space a bit) for distro in ubuntu centos; do tox -e venv -- sahara-image-create -x -u -p $PLUGIN -i $distro find . -maxdepth 1 -name '*cloudera*.qcow2' -delete rm -rf ~/.cache/image-create done ;; *) tox -e venv -- sahara-image-create -x -u -p $PLUGIN ;; esac

rather than "xsd:int",so it is changed.

Change-Id: I4f4f164e48a3e459774b3784ccb60780db5dd7d4

commit_message:
Compute v2.1 docs clean up (part15) (os-block-device-mapping)

  WADL file and JSON files are from v2 ext.
    Removes listServers
       (since it does not exist on
       nova/nova/api/openstack/compute/block_device_mapping.py)
    Adds block-device-mapping-v1
    URL path is changed from /v2 to /v2.1
    Keep JSON sample files only (XML sample files are not included)

P.S.
  All attributes of block-device mapping is in
    https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/kilo/nova/block_device.py
  (Both version)

Change-Id: I5aa201102aabd4b7581002f6eccca0b67e070fcb
Partial-Bug: #1488144
